programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Skipper Dwayne and the crew head to a consistent urchin dive spot, where young dingy boy George endures a baptism of fire as everyone fights to bring in the most urchins.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A lorry drives off a bridge two days before Christmas, leaving several vehicles dangling over a raging river. A new recruit to Jamie's team has to deal with the crisis.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are intrigued by a mysterious locked trunk when they visit the former home of a circus, and a zebra-print motorcycle also catches their eye.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are delighted when they visit a house packed with rare collectibles - but are less pleased by the prices the owner is asking for them.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: Ten men plunge into the wilderness with only a backpack, where they are forced to hunt, fend off predators and endure extreme isolation, but it remains to be seen who can stay alive the longest.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: A desperate hunt for clean water sends one survivalist on a perilous mission. Bears and wolves stalk many of the other men who are alone in the wilderness.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick fixes up a 1930s fishing boat, and takes on the tricky task of repairing a 19th-century coffee grinder.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Brettly restores a 19th-century gun vending machine, while Rick and the team work on the meter from a 1950s taxi.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A think-tank of top global experts examines whether America's founding fathers hid extra-terrestrial secrets in their documents, buildings and symbols.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.sub-title: Aliens and the Creation of Man
programme.desc: Can unexplained advances in human evolution be attributed to alien architects? Giorgio Tsoukalos joines forces with alien theorists to look at the evidence.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Australia's brumbies are widely regarded as pests and shot by choppers, so Matt Wright plans to relieve the problem by rounding up the horses and giving them a better life.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is impressed by a vintage caravan and a strange totem pole when he and Frank examine a veteran collector's hoard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank look for old arcade games during a power cut. They also come across a collection of motorbikes, but realise they may not be for sale.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Victor tries to end his losing streak in Waxahachie, but faces some tough competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend auctions in a small town where one of the teams acquires a strange wooden box that turns out to have unexpected value.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky is confronted with one of his biggest fears, and Victor gets more than he bargained for when he pursues a motorcycle.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Jenny Grumbles competes against her rivals to buy the locker of her dreams, while one of her fellow bidders demonstrates a darker side.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A stranger on a motorbike drives up the prices at an auction in DeSoto, where there are only four lockers up for grabs.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers make some risky bids when they attend an auction at Fort Worth.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers look for 1970s memorabilia in California, where Barry finds a relic from his past and Darrell discovers a lucrative medical device.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Santa Ana, California, where an inexpensive-looking locker could lead to a huge payout for one team.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell fights off competition as he tries to secure a locker worth $27,000, and Dave bids for a unit with a stockpile of antiques.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave has his eye on an electronics locker, and Darrell uncovers a classic movie prop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry asks a member of rock band Aerosmith for a valuation, and Dave discovers an antique toy.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave comes to blows with his estranged brother over rock memorabilia, and Barry discovers a valuable piece of modern art.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A mystery bidder begins to dominate the competition, pushing Dave to the limit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry discovers a mysterious locker with a strange hole in its wall, while Jarrod uses an old trick to put in a sneaky bid.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi learn that big cash comes in small packages, an indecisive Darrell finds himself in a bidder's quandary and Mark Balelo is back with all his usual bravado.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi find a rare jewellery box, while Dave is reluctant to join in the bidding wars.

programme.title: Spiky Gold Hunters
programme.desc: Skipper Dwayne and the crew head to a consistent urchin dive spot, where young dingy boy George endures a baptism of fire as everyone fights to bring in the most urchins.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The bladesmiths are tasked with forging a combat knife from an anti-tank hedgehog, leading to two gruelling rounds of competition filled with frustration and a medical emergency.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Marty and Rick Lagina and the team make a huge breakthrough as they decide to focus their efforts on a mysterious, triangle-shaped swamp.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: Morgan's big day goes awry when his plane breaks down, while Mike's supply run across the bay leaves him high and dry.

programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: The Texas Rangers return to Victoria to celebrate their victory over Mexico and Houston is encouraged to take an important role in the future of the newly independent territory.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Room 101 host Frank Skinner presides over an extended edition of the satirical quiz from June 2018, with playwright Lucy Prebble and comedian Henning Wehn joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.sub-title: A Helicopter is Quicker Than a Car
programme.desc: Dave discusses nature's warning signs and whether they can be trusted in the modern world.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan hosts an extended edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, with UKIP parliamentary spokesperson Suzanne Evans and comedian Henning Wehn joining regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's leading stories.

programme.title: Flack
programme.desc: In among the mayhem of a footballer's wedding, Robyn's life begins to fall apart. Will her whole house of cards collapse?.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Susan Calman, Sophie Willan, Ivo Graham and Sanjeev Bhaskar join Alan to tackle pressing issues such as Scotland, tin foil pants and instant mash.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hurricane Man
programme.desc: Josh Morgerman continues to document Hurricane Michael, as its devastating course progresses over Panama City. As 155mph winds wreak havoc on the city, it's a fight for survival.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Auckland, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, as their bodycams prove crucial for gathering evidence and nailing criminals.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force, featuring a hard-hitting mixture of body and observational footage, which reflect the daily challenges of combating crime and offer fresh insights into the fast-paced world of modern policing.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Border Patrol Agents along the legendary Rio Grande hunt down Mexican drug smugglers who are moving large stashes across the border.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Custom and Border Protection in Nogales, Arizona, look to intercept drugs even as cartels have become better than ever at hiding them in vehicles.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to a junkyard.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The items Mike and Frank bought in Europe arrive in the US, and the guys also visit a vintage car company.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the light-hearted panel show, which sees comedy actress Miranda Hart, TV and radio host Reggie Yates and Countryfile presenter John Craven competing to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room for ever. Their gripes include stuffed marrows, spitting, the hip-hop handshake and Miranda's breasts.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the comedy panel show, which sees veteran broadcaster Terry Wogan, cricketer-turned-TV personality Phil Tufnell and writer, presenter and poker player Victoria Coren Mitchell compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include food packaging, health fads, the 1990s Australian cricket team, hors d'oeuvres and people who walk around changing rooms naked.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Greg Davies, presenter and adventurer Ben Fogle and journalist Janet Street-Porter to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include people who use suitcases on wheels, multichannel TV, umbrellas, friends' hobbies and women who like to be treated as ladies.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Auckland, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A driver is stopped attempting to smuggle 15kg of cocaine across the border, and a truck driver's modified cab attracts attention at the World Trade Bridge.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: People forced out of their homes in Honduras by the notorious MS-13 gang plead their case for asylum in America. Officers discover 3,000lb of marijuana hidden in a cargo truck.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Independent Group MP Heidi Allen and stand-up Phil Wang joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference, with comedians Phill Jupitus, Josh Widdicombe and Sara Pascoe joining regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions on the topic of monsters.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Alistair McGowan, Kevin Bridges and Reginald D Hunter
programme.desc: Impressionist Alistair McGowan hosts the comedy show from London's Hammersmith Apollo, introducing Glaswegian Kevin Bridges and American Reginald D Hunter.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor ends his journey by learning to drive a stunt car, sampling Hollywood luxury in an executive jet, cruising in a 1950s hot rod and taking an aerial tour.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A floating bridge in Seattle, one of the longest such structures in the world, intended to connect the growing suburb of Bellevue with the high-tech downtown heart of the city. Plus, Albert Zwueste is on the Dutch Caribbean island of Curacao exploring one of the world's oldest surviving floating bridges, which helped inspire and inform the Seattle project.

programme.title: Samurai Warrior Queens
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary telling the story of Nakano Takeko, a female samurai who defied convention to lead a rebellion against Japan's western-influenced Emperor in 1868.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Ronnie Kray and the Pervert Peer
programme.desc: Fifty years ago, the Kray twins rose from small-time racketeers to head the most powerful criminal organisation London had ever seen. This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Chronicling the events that brought about the demise of the Third Reich, as the Allies arrived at the gates of Berlin and Hitler boarded himself up in his bunker, where it is believed he committed suicide. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How Japan's early victories over Allied forces during the Second World War convinced its people that their strength and discipline would bring them victory. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where America's two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Enola Gay drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima in August 1945 as America bids to secure an unconditional surrender from the Japanese, even though conventional bombing raids had already flattened the country. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The award-winning documentary series reveals how the end of the Second World War resulted in Britain's military and economic exhaustion, leaving Europe at the mercy of sparring superpowers as the Cold War era dawned. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A classic car fan with a love of the Jaguar E-Type reluctantly sends his dream car to auction, hoping to buy a motorhome with the money. Two Ford Escorts get Dave's pulse racing.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A widow reluctantly parts with her husband's treasured collection of Rolls Royces and Bentleys, and an impulse buyer finds one of the cars a new home.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Documentary following the exploits of a family-run crew of heavy-haulage specialists as they transport the heaviest, longest and most precious locomotives around the world. Terry and Jason have been called in to move legendary steam locomotive Britannia. The 68-year-old vehicle has undergone a major restoration in Crewe and is scheduled to start running at the Severn Valley Railway.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Expert hauliers Eric Harrison and Chris Case move an iconic Deltic diesel, better known as The Royal Highland Fusilier, halfway across the country to the Telford Steam Fair.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day examines the 1949 murder of wealthy widow Olive Durand, and the gruesome confession made by the man who was brought in for questioning.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Nicholas Day investigates the murder of two teenagers in 1953, their bodies discovered the day before and a few days after the Queen's coronation.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Herbert Rowse Armstrong, who was convicted of murdering his wife with arsenic. Much of the evidence against him was circumstantial and the scientific testimony remains disputed. This episode examines both sides of the case and asks whether the British justice system made a terrible mistake.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Alfonse is whisked to hospital with heart trouble after being interrogated by the Gestapo. Rene feigns a bout of food poisoning in a bid to rescue his friend before he spills the beans about the stolen money. With Gorden Kaye, Kenneth Connor and Carmen Silvera.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Herr Flick arrests Leclerc and issues a proclamation he'll be shot if the stolen Gestapo money is not returned, while Edith is in a romantic mood and Fanny decides to bake a potato.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The wedding of Edith's mother Fanny to Monsieur Leclerc is brought forward to coincide with the execution of Michelle's most audacious plan to date.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Claustrophobic prison cells that contain a story worthy of international acclaim, and a vast mountainside complex that held the power to change the world.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Customs seize a massive heroin shipment and Kavanagh agrees to prosecute the importer, a self-made man with all the trappings of success, including a yacht and a villa in Portugal. Unfortunately, he also has a staff of hired heavies who make the mistake of threatening Lizzie in a bid to get him off the hook - thus setting the scene for a bitterly personal courtroom wrangle. John Thaw and Lisa Harrow star.

programme.title: Cadfael
programme.desc: When the medieval monk investigates the murder of a wealthy cleric, the finger of suspicion immediately points to a new arrival at the abbey, but as Cadfael digs deeper, he uncovers connections to a family with tangled loyalties. Drama, starring Derek Jacobi, Terence Hardiman, Michael Culver, Ian McNeice, Christien Anholt and Julian Glover.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The corpse of a recently married man is found hidden in an antique suit of armour - much to Lovejoy's dismay. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Old Mill Herbary at Bodmin, Cornwall, where a wide range of herbs and medicinal plants are cultivated.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: A singing star turns up at the surgery demanding a repeat prescription, but the exact nature of her illness proves elusive. Meanwhile, Dr Finlay considers starting afresh elsewhere. Medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Having discovered Irene Radford is back, Gina is determined to put her old enemy behind bars once and for all - and the two are soon face to face again when an intruder at the Radford house turns out to be Irene herself, who claims she has returned because she is critically ill with cancer. However, the police have got wind that she is plotting one final raid before retiring from a life of crime for good, so Phil is tasked to monitor a prison meeting between Irene and her son David, where the top brass are hoping he'll glean valuable information about the job. Unfortunately, the philandering DS is easily distracted by an old flame working at the prison and misses half the conversation - so when the raid gets under way, it soon becomes clear they've been duped, and a senior officer ends up staring down the barrel of Irene's gun. Back at the station, Honey is upset to learn that Amber has taken the 'shy and sensitive' Steve Hunter's virginity, while Sam seems to be warming to Phil. Is ro.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Following the Radford family's botched attempt to spring David from prison, Irene drives off with Gina at gunpoint and forces the inspector to let her colleagues know she means business. If they don't give up the chase, she won't hesitate to pull the trigger. Soon, Gina finds herself alone with her enemy, and as they begin to talk, the two of them realise they understand one another better than they could possibly have imagined. However, when Irene orders the shooting of Jack Gaunt, it becomes clear Gina is still in very real danger. Meanwhile, Honey has it out with Steve, disappointed that he had sex with Amber, and accusing him of being as bad as his brother. Indeed, Phil is having his fair share of problems as Sam discovers that his New Year's invitation followed hard on the heels of his dalliance with the prison liaison officer. Roberta Taylor, Lynda Bellingham, Lisa Maxwell and Scott Maslen star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Staff shortages cause tension in CPU, with Ramani bearing the brunt as she struggles to cope with an increased workload - and when an outside source brings the matter to Adam's attention, the situation becomes hugely political, only serving to aggravate the already volatile relationship between Jack and Neil. By way of an immediate solution, Jack assigns Terry to help Ramani with the case of a man suspected of being a paedophile - but Ramani is worried about Terry's ability to deal with such a task given his own traumatic background. Meanwhile, the rest of the relief let their hair down at Lance's stag party - but when the guest of honour nips outside for a breath of fresh air, he is suddenly attacked from behind by a group who put a bag over his head and bundle him into the back of a van. It could just be a stag night prank - or it could be something more serious. Guest starring Annabelle Apsion and Colm O'Maonlai.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Lance is missing on his wedding day, as friends try to 'cure' him of his homosexuality. Terry tries to prove his suspicions that brother Ben is a child abuser, while no-nonsense new DC Jo Masters arrives at Sun Hill to defuse the tension between Jack and Neil - but proves to be their worst nightmare.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The amateur sleuth disguises herself as a battered wife in an attempt to find out who is threatening the future of a women's refuge. Hetty's quest to find the leak opens her eyes to the terrifying realities of spousal abuse, and results in a gripping conclusion as she leads the women in defending their sanctuary against a violent motorcycle gang.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: When her niece's son is charged with possession of an ecstasy tablet, suspicions remain that he has been framed, so Hetty goes undercover in his school as a cafeteria worker to clear his name. Patricia Routledge stars.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Colour Blind
programme.desc: Drama from the best-selling author. Set between the wars, it concerns a girl who returns to her Tyneside home newly married to her black husband, only to encounter bigotry from all sides, to say nothing of her obsessed brother's animosity. Niamh Cusack, Tony Armatrading and Dearbhla Molloy star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is gripped by an outbreak of dysentery, but that's the least of mum-to-be Marie Amos's worries when her husband Tony is arrested for gross indecency in the gentlemen's toilets and faces a criminal hearing. Nurse Crane meets Dolores McEvoy, a pregnant Irish woman who is clearly malnourished - but when she visits the woman's home, it turns out she has given a false address and has disappeared. Trixie is delighted when Tom asks her to oversee her first official church duty since their engagement, while at Nonnatus House, Fred tackles a rat infestation - only for Sister Monica Joan to work against him. With guest appearances by Cara Theobold (Downton Abbey) and Richard Fleeshman (Coronation Street).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Winifred's eyes are opened to Poplar's seedy underworld when she cares for expectant prostitute Bridget Cole. Horrified by the young woman's lack of awareness, she draws on her teaching experience, and with help from Sgt Noakes sets out to promote safe sex to all local working girls. Barbara struggles to understand why expectant father Frank Robbins would pressure his wife to bear him a son, while Sister Monica Joan is feeling sidelined - until she finds herself unexpectedly assisting Shelagh with an emergency birth. Trixie invites herself along to a meeting between Tom and the Bishop - but things get tense when the idea of the couple moving to Newcastle is raised.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry celebrates his birthday at a comedy club, where a controversial act comes under fire from a group of hecklers. Sandra discovers the most vocal member of the gang is the niece of a political activist who went missing 25 years previously after waging a campaign against the comedian. Agreeing to reinvestigate the disappearance, the squad discovers that the activist and her boyfriend had infiltrated an extreme right-wing group with links to the dangerous criminal who murdered Jack's wife. Guest starring Phil Daniels, Joe Absolom and John Henshaw.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh stars as the world-weary Swedish detective in a fourth and final series of adaptations of Henning Mankell's novels. Wallander travels to Cape Town to investigate the disappearance of a Swedish woman. He uncovers a complex conspiracy behind the mystery, and is also confronted with a nation that has reached a turning point in its history.

programme.title: Gregory's Girl (1981)
programme.desc: A gawky teenager is dismayed to be relegated to goalkeeper in the school football team - but his thoughts turn to romance once he meets the female striker who takes his place. However, his awkward nature proves an obstacle to winning her over, despite the sage advice of his worldly-wise little sister. Comedy, starring John Gordon Sinclair, Dee Hepburn, Jake D'Arcy, Clare Grogan and Robert Buchanan.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor (1996)
programme.desc: An obese, terminally shy professor invents a potion that transforms him into a slim, loud-mouthed charmer. His new streamlined self immediately sets out to woo the woman of his dreams - but soon starts to ride roughshod over everything he used to care about. Remake of the 1963 Jerry Lewis comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Jada Pinkett Smith, James Coburn and Larry Miller.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: Keith takes funnyman Rob Beckett to a toy store and hunts for vintage clothes with his friend and former Celebrity Juice sparring partner Fearne Cotton.

programme.title: Teach My Pet to Do That
programme.desc: A miniature horse and working cocker spaniel are taught how to shut multiple kitchen cupboard doors, and a raccoon demonstrates some of the tricks in its repertoire, including riding a bike and pushing a pram. Plus, the trainers hit the road to help a young girl scout train her pet rat Lily to do an agility course. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Dino Dana
programme.desc: Dad tries to get Dana up and ready for school, but she is busy dreaming about discovering the first T Rex fossil.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: While the members of International Rescue attend a prestigious global airshow, a test pilot unveils an ultra-fast superjet.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare will see him attempt a bungee jump, but has he got the nerve to launch himself off the side of the Tees Transporter bridge?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: The Tom and Jerry detective agency takes the case of a dog whose fortune cookie has gone missing.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom uses an unlucky bone to scare Spike and Jerry.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Weasel tends to Fizz's toothache, but Magoo turns up, thinking he's busting into an animal testing lab..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean becomes obsessed with gaming after being introduced by Mrs. Wicket's nephew. He decides he must have his own console!.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.sub-title: Poison in the Pit of the Plum
programme.desc: Po and the students encounter a gang who want to fight Po, which leads them to discovering Jindiao's evil plan..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of Grenada, where he prepares pork with sweet potato mash and nutmeg cream sauce, and discovers why the spice is so important to the island. He also visits a rum distillery powered by a water wheel and makes a cocktail using a local chocolate liquor, and gets introduced to Grenada's national dish by chef Brian Benjamin.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up their Thai 'no fish' cakes and demonstrate how to turn meat-free sausages into smoky chorizo for a piri piri traybake. Michelin-starred chef Alexis Gauthier shows how he has transformed a classic French pate into a vegan 'faux gras', there are ideas for healthy smoothies and, for dessert, no-egg mini banoffee meringues with cashew cream and caramel sauce.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia arrives in the Dodecanese, a far-flung group of islands at the gateway between Europe and the East. On the largest. Rhodes, she uncovers a treasure of trove of Byzantine art and has masterclass in painting historic frescoes. Travelling inland to the mountain village of Apollona, she meets some female entrepreneurs producing an age-old superfood made from honey and sesame. Julia's trip ends with a visit to the neighbouring island of Symi where, after sampling the local shrimps, she receives a lesson in the ancient and dangerous skill of sponge diving.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The penultimate round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' will.i.am, Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Meghan Trainor seek out the nation's best vocal talent. The coveted spaces on the coaches' teams are filling up and as ever, there is a simple twist to the auditions - with the four coaches selecting their teams without being able to see them, looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the semi-final of the celebrity singing contest. Duck, Fox, Hedgehog, Octopus and Queen Bee are the five remaining singers and this week two more will be unmasked and eliminated, leaving only three to go through to next week's final. Ken Jeong returns to the panel, joining regulars Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross and Davina McCall in trying to guess the famous faces are behind the costumes.

programme.title: The Secret Life of Pets (2016)
programme.desc: When rivalry leaves them cast adrift on the streets of New York, two bickering hounds must put their differences aside and pull together. Animated adventure from the makers of Despicable Me, featuring the voices of Louis CK, Eric Stonestreet and Kevin Hart.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Ruth Davidson, Mark King, Ferne McCann and Dan Walker pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners take to the arena once more, performing routines based on a selection of different dance style. Kevin Kilbane won't be among them, having lost out in last week's skate-off to H. Which of tonight's celebrities will find themselves in the bottom two? Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: As Morse sees in 1970 at a Venetian opera, Thursday and the team are faced with a grisly murder on an Oxford towpath. Back in Oxford, Morse meets a kindred spirit, while a ground-breaking college project becomes a fatal battle of the sexes. Shaun Evans stars as the cerebral detective, in an episode he also directed, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser and Sean Rigby.

programme.title: The Food and Drink Awards in Association with Staysure and thefoodawards.com
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts this event from the Merchant Taylors' Hall in London celebrating the UK's position as one of the world's leaders in food and drink, which has risen to an all-time high in the past few years. Awards include best organic producer, best family run restaurant and outstanding achievement, while contributors include Jeni Barnett, Andi Oliver, Linda Robson, Rosemary Shrager and Tom Read Wilson.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Bradley is on the mend following his rodeo injury and determined to get back behind the wheel of the RV. As the pair continue on their journey, Barney is thrilled to be celebrating his birthday with a trip to the iconic Niagara Falls. Later, Bradley and Barney take the RV on a small cargo ferry as they head to Vermont. Here, the pair have a go at ice climbing, which proves treacherous for them and the crew, before a spot of dog sledding through the frozen wilderness and an inevitable race through the forests.

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the second round of fixtures, featuring France v Italy at Stade de France, Ireland v Wales at Aviva Stadium and Scotland v England at Murrayfield.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: The twins ride the Redball Express, while Bruce Crompton blows up a van with Second World War rifle grenades and tracks down a 'Deuce-and-a-half' American army truck.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: Aliens, Monsters and Demons: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Examining the evidence uncovered over the two seasons of the programme - from the most famous exorcism in history to possible proof that UFOs exist.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini attempts to auction off a number of different vehicles to help him in his quest to obtain a 1911 Winton 17b.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A woman asks Wayne Carini to help sell her late husband's 1965 Shelby Cobra 427.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The second winner is revealed as the guys head to Texas to spend some time with her and learn about what she wants her chopper to look like. S3/63/25 (HOH).

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: A 1965 Cadillac so full of leaves and rat droppings that it's a health hazard. Plus, a 1984 Monte Carlo intended as an anniversary present.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: Jimmy, Ant and Helen reimagine a modern Beetle with a '50s American Roadster look. Plus, Ant transforms a classic Royal Enfield motorcycle into a race bike.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacture of dial thermometers, hummus and straw sombreros.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How everyday items such as tequila, waterbeds and flip flops are manufactured.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit the Cotswolds and Somerset, where finds include a set of milk churns and an old munitions shell.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: An insight into the design specifications of the Porsche 911.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. They scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: Jimmy, Ant and Helen reimagine a modern Beetle with a '50s American Roadster look. Plus, Ant transforms a classic Royal Enfield motorcycle into a race bike.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: Colin Murray presents a round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Nottingham Forest v Leeds United and Barnsley v Sheffield Wednesday.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While Frank Fritz is on the mend. Mike Wolfe and his brother Robbie crisscross Colorado and find a giant cow-shaped RV.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Robbie uncover a hidden stash of awesome motorcycle relics at a Colorado property littered with massive man-mobiles.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A junkyard wizard has an Oktoberfest gem with Frank Fritz's name written all over it.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: It's the end of the mining season and the last chance for the teams. The Rookies gamble their hopes on one last haul of opal and the Opal Queen makes a final desperate dig.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The captains must make hard choices as Typhoon Nuri closes in. The Northwestern charges into the storm, while the Cape Caution retreats to land.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a Porsche 914 in a barn and thinks he can turn a profit on the 1970s sports car. Edd China has the tricky job of restoring it to a saleable condition.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a G Wagen, a popular German 4x4. Mechanic Edd China spruces it up with a 2012 front end and rear lights, but it may not be enough for them to turn a profit.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit the Cotswolds and Somerset, where finds include a set of milk churns and an old munitions shell.

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Ian's fleet of ageing tractors buckle under the strain of the first harvest of the year. Ally faces spiralling costs as his new campsite venture slips months behind schedule.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Seaton, Devon, Drew Pritchard dashes under a staircase for a pair of floodlights. In Yorkshire, he uses a penknife to see if a newly upholstered chair hides a valuable original.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a 13th-century manor house in Yorkshire, Drew Pritchard uncovers a wartime flag with a medical history. He also visits a neo-gothic cathedral in Edinburgh.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: A team of international investigators conducts a definitive inquiry into the possibility that Adolf Hitler may have survived the conclusion of the Second World War. Here the experts discover secret tunnels linking Hitler's bunker to Tempelhof Airport. After faking his own death, they wonder if the Nazi leader could have escaped by plane.

programme.title: Aaron Hernandez: An ID Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Part one of two. After NFL football player Aaron Hernandez's friend Odin Lloyd was found dead near his home, investigators turned their gaze on the sportsman.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: A look at real-life criminal cases apparenttly inspired by the 1999 film Fight Club, with interviews with investigators and family members of victims.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of mother and daughter Angela and Ashley Hyke who went missing in July 2001, leaving candles burning and electric fans running in their home. Days later their bodies were found in shallow graves. Authorities quickly recognised that the key to identifying the murderer might lie in Angela's diary.

programme.title: Casey Anthony: An American Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Recounting one of the most talked-about cases in US legal history, which began when 22-year-old Florida woman Casey Anthony claimed that her two-year-old daughter Caylee had been taken by her nanny. Investigators, however, soon discovered that the child has been missing for 31 days. Caylee's remains were later found wrapped in a blanket in woodland near her Florida home.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Vet Dave White heads for the desert to treat a dog with cactus spines stuck in its mouth.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown heads to Abu Dhabi after a special invitation to visit an extraordinary veterinary hospital, where sick and injured falcons are treated like royalty.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kleinfeld's welcomes a variety of clients, from a bride with a liking for vintage fashion, to a biker chick with more outlandish tastes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer knows what she wants from her dress, but her bridesmaids do not like the idea and push her into trying other styles.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: UK
programme.desc: Rule-breaking brides visit Confetti & Lace, as blue-haired bride Stephanie wants a dress with colour and Virginia brings her fiance to help choose a gown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris is reunited with an old friend, Pluto the singing dalmatian. Plus, cocker spaniel Dusty needs radical ear surgery.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Terrier Benji is suffering from a heart murmur that could be fatal without immediate surgery. Dr Chris Brown entrusts the dog's operation to Dr Andrew Marchevsky.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At 605lbs, Tracey carries most of her body weight in her misshapen legs - which are so extreme she needs someone to lift them out of bed. She turns to medic Dr Nowzaradan for help in losing weight.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: An update on the stories of obese Americans who set out to turn their lives around, including James who is suspected of cheating as he continues to gain weight. Cynthia continues to lose weight, but seems satisfied to do so at her own pace.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride learns quickly that her family is not always on her side, while another struggles to get any opinions on dresses from her wedding party.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride and her sister disagree about the bridesmaids wearing a form-fitting dress, while another battles with her mother about necklines.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bridesmaid searching for a husband threatens to leave the bridal party is she is not able to show off her body in a short dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Bridesmaids are told they just need to show up to their fitting, but when the bride is unable to decide on a colour her party begin to get fed up.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A tantrum erupts after a bride overlooks her daughter for her future stepdaughter, making the salon begin to feel like a nursery school.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Angie has always dreamed of a laidback country wedding - but her sister Carolina wants her bridesmaid dress to be sparkly, and is determined to get her way.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A maid of honour turns into a monster when it is pointed out she is the only unmarried maid - and when the tension rises, it is left to the bride-to-be to save the day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A soon-to-be-married woman's best friend is furious about her decision to appoint a man as her 'male of honour'.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride sets out to find a green dress that matches her emerald engagement ring, and to complicate matters she is determined it has to be the exact same shade.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A consultant meets 18-year-old bride Kelsey, who arrives with plenty of drama over a broken promise about who would be her maid of honour.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Barbara Christiansen rescues two emaciated dogs, leaving the Houston SPCA team with a fight to save the animals' lives.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Chief investigator Max Mixson rescues a seriously injured dog and surgeons battle to save its life.

programme.title: Long Lost Family Australia
programme.desc: Colin is on a quest to find his estranged son after not seeing him for four decades. Plus, 28-year-old Shane was adopted at birth and yearns to meet his birth mother. Chrissie Swan and Anh Do present.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Shana Grice was murdered after being stalked by her ex-boyfriend, Michael Lane. He denied involvement, but experts examined police videos to determine the truth.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Weighing over 700lbs, Nicole is on the verge of leaving her children motherless. She commits to the diet programme, but a crisis threatens to derail all her hopes.

programme.title: Aaron Hernandez: An ID Murder Mystery
programme.desc: Part two of two. At trial, a sensational family drama unfolded as Aaron Hernandez's fiancee testified for the prosecution. Later, links to another brutal slaying emerged.
